title: Hewlett-Packard Data Protector Cell Manager Remote Code Execution Vulnerabilities
description:
This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on vulnerable installations of HP Data Protector Cell Manager. Authentication is not required to exploit these vulnerabilities.
The specific flaws exist within the crs.exe process which listens on a random TCP port. The process fails to properly handle multiple message types and copies user-supplied data into fixed-length buffers. A remote attacker can abuse this to execute remote code under the context of the SYSTEM user.
addtionnal_details: Hewlett-Packard has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:http://h20000.www2.hp.com/bizsupport/TechSupport/Document.jsp?objectID=c02688353
timeline:
2010-06-02 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2011-01-20 - Coordinated public release of advisory
